translated: 8,000 verses of the Prajnaparamita Sutra, 108
Sutra on the Dharani of the True Ultimate Meaning
Tripiá¹­aka Master from the Western Regions, Chao Feng Da Fu Shi Guang Lu Qing
I take refuge in the supreme mother of all buddhas, the Prajnaparamita Dharma,
From which all buddhas of the past, present, and future are born.
The good and virtuous buddhas are the mother of the buddhas, with the purity of the nature of non-existence,
The Buddha extensively explained for Subhuti, now briefly collected as he spoke.
The Prajnaparamita has one hundred and eight names:
First, the supreme Prajnaparamita, second, omniscience, third, the cognition of all aspects, fourth, the ultimate reality, fifth, suchness, sixth, indestructible suchness,
Seventh, unchanging suchness, eighth, true nature, ninth, arising in accordance with reality, tenth,
eleventh, non-inverted, twelfth, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, thirteenth, naturelessness,
fourteenth, intrinsic nature, fifteenth, nature of dharmas,
sixteenth, dharma realm, seventeenth, dharma determination, eighteenth, dharma abiding, nineteenth,
dharma non-self, twentieth, dharma characteristics, twenty-first, non-sentient being,
twenty-second, non-life, twenty-third, non-nourishment, twenty-fourth,
non-person, twenty-fifth, non-pudgala, twenty-sixth, non-language,
twenty-seventh, non-path of language, twenty-eighth, free from mind, thought, and cognition,
twenty-ninth, unequaled, thirtieth, unequaled, thirty-first, free from pride,
thirty-second, non-self, thirty-third, free from conceptual proliferation, thirty-fourth, free from

Contemplating dependent origination, 97. Not seeking, 98. Without concealment,
99. Nothing exists, 100. Originally nothing is done, 101.
Not two, 102. Not without two, 103. The tranquil wisdom
has nowhere to go, 104. Unbound, unstained, and equal to space, 105.
Free from the ten characteristics of speech, 106. The self-nature of all dharmas is like an illusion or dream,
107. Like a potter's wheel, 108. All dharmas have the same flavor.
